channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: There’s no turning back on AI now, this firm says as it boosts S&P 500 forecast
item.description: As Nvidia offers blowout results, Barclays says back the AI trade as it’s not going away and that means tech dominance is here to stay.

item.title: ‘He’s executor of his dad’s estate’: Should my son use his late father’s bank account to pay for funeral expenses?
item.description: “There’s no trust in place, but there is a will.”

item.title: IBM and Cisco have a new partnership as they target a ‘quantum-computing internet’
item.description: The fruits of the partnership are admittedly years away as the companies strive for a connected fault-scale network by the “early 2030s.”

item.title: Americans in rural areas are struggling the most with housing affordability
item.description: Rural America is feeling the painful toll of the housing-affordability crisis.

item.title: ‘He lived alone in Section 8 housing’: My late uncle’s landlord disposed of his art collection. What can we do?
item.description: “The management company said they would store his belongings.”

item.title: Nvidia posted another monster quarter. Here is the number that impressed analysts the most
item.description: Nvidia was able to clear another sky high earnings bar, with analysts left most impressed by one number: its Blackwell and Rubin chips sales guidance.

item.title: Nvidia delivers big once again, and investors brush aside the bigger picture about AI spending
item.description: The real debate — whether all this AI capacity being built today will be profitable tomorrow — remains unresolved.

item.title: Saba Capital activist investor Boaz Weinstein sees 'storm brewing' in UK investment trusts — and has pounced on these two names
item.description: Activist hedge fund manager Boaz Weinstein unveiled two bets in the U.K. investment trust space at this year's Sohn London event.

item.title: Adobe’s $1.9B Semrush Buyout Sparks Epic Stock Rally
item.description: Adobe's $1.9B acquisition of Semrush (SEMR) sends shares soaring 74% as of Nov 19, 2025. Dive into the AI-driven deal, market reactions, risks, and le...

item.title: TJX results show it's eating Target's lunch. Why that will continue
item.description: TJX is showing consistency with its earnings reports, analysts say.

item.title: Private assets in 401(k)s could boost long-term performance. Here's how some are already making it work
item.description: Private equity and private credit may improve returns of 401(k) plans in the long term, if done right, recent studies have shown.

item.title: Olema Pharma (OLMA) Surges 140%+ on Roche Cancer Data
item.description: Olema Pharmaceuticals (OLMA) stock explodes 145% today on Roche's positive breast cancer drug data. Explore the catalyst, risks, rewards, and how simi...

item.title: Sigma Lithium (SGML) Rockets 40% Pre-Market on Lithium Demand Boom

item.title: PLUG Stock Explodes on UK Hydrogen Project Win

item.title: Firefly Aerospace (FLY): A Compelling Re-Rating Opportunity in Responsive Space and Defense
